thig12.1:1.1: 'sīte' appears to be locative - perhaps locative of time. So I think it is referring to when the weather is cold, not the water that she is collecting. So perhaps this could be translated "I used to fetch water in the cold" or something similar.
thig12.1:1.2: You left out the word 'sadā' - "always going into the water."
thig12.1:1.3: Bonus points for catching that 'ayyānaṁ' is masculine - not feminine (Bhante Sujāto translated it as feminine!)
